data.title: Frist Art Museum
data.meta_description: The Frist Art Museum opened in April 2001 and has since hosted touring exhibitions from some of the most prestigious collections in the world, as well as award-winning shows organized in-house. Our exhibitions change every few months, so plan to visit often to see what’s new.
data.text:
See what's coming to the Frist in 2025!

We are so excited to announce our 2025 schedule of exhibitions!

Food culture in the age of Impressionism · Venice and the Ottoman Empire · Contemporary African Masquerade Artists · David Driskell and Contemporaries · American Quilting · Paul McCartney Photographs · Contemporary Haitian Artists Didier William and M. Florine Démosthène · American Painter Ellen Altfest and More!

The Grilled Cheeserie will debut a new bistro concept in the Frist Café on September 5!

The Frist Art Museum and The Grilled Cheeserie are excited to announce Café Cheeserie, a creative new concept from The Grilled Cheeserie featuring a new fromage-focused, bistro-inspired menu, weekly and seasonal specials, as well as many favorites from the Hillsboro location and Food Truck. Café Cheeserie opens to the public on Thursday, September 5 and will be serving all hours the Frist is open.

We're currently accepting applications for spring 2025 internships!

The Frist’s college internship program introduces students to the many career pathways within a museum. We are now accepting applications for paid internships in our communications, curatorial, development, and education & engagement departments for the spring 2025 semester.

The deadline to apply is Monday, October 14.

Sign up to become a Frist volunteer!

Join our team! We are looking for people of all ages to help in Guest Services, the gift shop, and Martin ArtQuest. Volunteers enjoy FREE access to all our exhibitions, free parking, discounts in the gift shop, and more! It’s a wonderful way to meet new people and support the arts. Submit your application by September 18 to be included in the next training session on Saturday, September 21.

Watch current volunteer Jamie Celmer talk about her experience as a volunteer.
